page.title: 03SWALE POLICE
page.content: P.C.Wells is a police officer who works in the Juvenile Bureau.He has been in the force for 18 years and is an everyday sort of person.He said that "protection of life and property; prevention of crime and prosecution of offenders" are his main duties.The main crime in Sittingbourne is robbery.Over 1000 different crimes were committed last year in the area. The'Grove',Murston and schools have the most problems.Drug abuse has increased with port facilities at Sheppey.In and average Sittingbourne week there are 10.12 burglaries. Fortunately there are not many muggings.104 children were arrested for crimes last year.About 10 bicycles are stolen each week,most of them without a post-code.There are 6 cells at the station which are seldom all occupied at once.
